page.title: 10Prize_Winning Beasts, Mulben
page.content: A Mulben farm, The Tam, was in the News at the end of May. Three beasts from it were sold at the Heavy Cattle Auction at the Central Auction Mart in Stirling. The beasts were bullocks {Blackie }and {Creamy,}and heifer,{Jean. }The two bullocks and the heifer were the heaviest cattle in the United Kingdom. The heaviest of the three beasts, Creamy, weighed 1194 kilos. The lightest, Jean, weighed 1004 kilos. To fatten his cattle, Mr. Addison, the farmer fed them a barrowload of turnips each daily, along with corn, cake and bulk fodder. After winning the prize as heaviest cattle, the beasts were sold. When we went to Mr. Addison's house, he showed us their photographs, their rosettes and the sponsoring Bank of Scotland's blue sash from each beast.
